item.title: Director, Data Science (Machine Learning)
item.description:
You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

Job Description:

Role Summary

As one of Sun Life Canada’s largest business units, Insurance Solutions is responsible for designing and distributing leading-edge life and health insurance products to over 2 million individual retail Clients across Canada.

Reporting to the AVP, Innovation and Analytics, the Director will lead machine learning and predictive analytics initiatives within Insurance Solutions to conceptualize, develop, and operationalize data science solutions for specific use cases across multiple functional areas including underwriting, sales, product management and actuarial.  The successful candidate will hire and lead a high-performing team of data scientists and provide thought leadership on the application of advanced analytics to business problems.  This role currently has two (2) direct reports.

The ideal candidate is a challenge-seeking, intellectually curious, results-oriented analytics leader with a hands-on mentality and passion for leveraging data to drive business outcomes.

What will you do?

  • Hire and lead a team of data scientists to identify, develop, and operationalize high quality, robust machine learning solutions to meet the use cases of key functional areas within Insurance Solutions (e.g. underwriting, sales, product management, actuarial)

  • Lead the research, development, and enhancement of existing models (e.g. Sun Life’s accelerated underwriting model)

  • Lead the research and evaluation of new data sources, both internal and external; apply machine learning and deep learning techniques to extract actionable insights from available data; write complex SQL queries to extract and integrate data from multiple database sources

  • Liaise with senior executives, product managers, actuaries and sales teams, to define use cases and deliver innovative solutions in order to help meet their business growth and profitability objectives

  • Coach and grow a high-performing team of data scientists with clear direction and proactive leadership, strategic assignment of responsibilities, and other training opportunities

What do you need to succeed?

  • M.S. or PhD in mathematics, computer science or other relevant fields, or equivalent work experience

  • 6+ years of industry experience with 4+ years leading data science projects with hands-on experience building and deploying statistical / machine learning models

  • 3+ years experience in managing a team of data scientists

  • Extensive knowledge of machine learning and deep learning tools and concepts (e.g. Random Forests, Neural Networks, XGBoost), including applications in NLP

  • Experience using one or more statistical programming languages (e.g., Python, R) to work with data sets

What will be nice to have?

  • Life and health insurance industry experience, preferably a background in underwriting, distribution, actuarial, or product management

  • Experience with cloud-based big data tools and platforms: AWS, SageMaker

  • In depth understanding of big data technologies: Hadoop, HDFS, Hive, HBase, Storm, Spark, Kafka

  • Experience with data analytics and data visualization best practices

What’s in it for you?

  • Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data

  • 20 days vacation per year and an innovative sabbatical program

  • A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture in a hybrid, remote environment

  • Being part of our Analytics community, where we share best practices and broaden skill sets

  • Flexible Benefits from the day you join to meet the needs of you and your family

  • Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security

  • Fitness and wellness programs that help you balance work and life and enjoy a healthier lifestyle

The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results. 

Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Salary Range:

104,000/104 000 - 171,700/171 700

Job Category:

Advanced Analytics

Posting End Date:

13/03/2022

item.title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer (Remote)
item.description:
You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

Job Description:

Role Summary

This role reports to AVP, Advanced AI Initiatives in Business Excellence. Business Excellence leads transformation in Canadian Operations at Sun Life. This role will work with a team of data scientists to pioneer creating new AI capabilities to help improve business outcomes across Sun Life’s Canadian Operations.

What will you do?

  • Work with multidisciplinary teams with different business and technical backgrounds to identifying cutting edge AI solutions that might be applicable to our business problems

  • Preparing datasets, training models and fine-tuning models to extract actionable insights from big unstructured datasets

  • Create visualizations that helps to transform data into actionable insights for non-experts

  • Help to develop working application prototypes

  • Present your work/findings to a wide audience from beginner to experts

What do you need to succeed?

  • Masters or PhD degree in relevant discipline

  • 3-​5 years experience with either Automatic Speech Recognition systems/ Natural Language Processing/ Conversational AI or Information Extraction, tools and techniques-

  • 5 years hands on experience with Python, particularly with data science related packages and visualization techniques

  • 5 years experience with Deep Learning frameworks such as Tensorflow or PyTorch

  • Extensive knowledge of Machine Learning and Deep Learning tools and concepts

  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and perform well in team projects

  • Good knowledge of database concepts and SQL

  • Solid production level coding skills

  • Excellent communication skills

What will be nice to have?

  • Experience with C/C++, Java, Scala, R

  • Experience working with SQL/Unix command-line

  • Published paper in AI conferences such as NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR etc.

  • Experience in signal processing and pattern recognition

  • Knowledge of ASR technologies and tools such as: acoustic modeling, language modeling, HMM, WFST, neural networks, feature extraction, Kaldi

Unique Requirements

The candidate selected for this role is required to have special clearance from the Royal Canadian Mounted Police. To see if you are eligible for this clearance, please review the information on Federal Government site (https://www.tpsgc-

pwgsc.gc.ca/esc-src/personnel/pdcf-rsrp-eng.html)

What’s in it for you?

  • Competitive salary influenced by market range data

  • 20 days vacation per year

  • Remote work/ Hybrid Work environment

  • A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture

  • Flexible Benefits from the day you join to meet the needs of you and your family

  • Fitness and wellness programs that help you balance work and life and enjoy a healthier lifestyle

  • Being part of our Analytics community, where we share best practices and broaden skill-sets

The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results. 

Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Salary Range:

74,900/74 900 - 125,900/125 900

Job Category:

Advanced Analytics

Posting End Date:

13/03/2022

item.title: Senior Data Scientist
item.description:
You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

Job Description:

Role Summary

Within Sun Life, the Analytics & Insights teams are comprised of savvy and intellectually curious professionals who are on a mission to transform how we apply data and analytics to support Sun Life becoming client-centric. An integral part of the Analytics & Insights organization, the Data Science team supports Canadian business units in their journey to leverage data and analytics as a foundational pillar in delivering business value

The Senior Data Scientist will focus on supporting Canadian business units in accelerating the growth and application of analytics in driving value.  The senior data scientist will leverage practical experience in applying varied data science techniques & offering advice/inputs to help with the design, development and implementation of analytics use cases.

Sun Life views success in this role in demonstration of these key attributes:

Fierce curiosity. You are drawn to discovering and leveraging new data and taking on challenging business puzzles. An inquisitive mind. Driven to ask questions to help lead projects to commercial value and not being afraid that the innovation attempts can and will lead to failing. A passion for solving problems.  The most successful data scientists’ solution for what the right data to use, they solve using the most suitable (not most advanced) algorithms for the problem at hand and figure out how to execute and deliver with highest efficiency. Technical skills in both data and computer science. There are 3 core technical skills we look for: in-depth coding knowledge of an analytical tool(s) (i.e., Python); data science techniques and concepts; working with structured data (SQL) Thirst for learning. You are a data scientist who is constantly updating their knowledge of data science state-of-the-art.

What will you do?

  • Apply best in breed data science including descriptive, predictive and machine learning techniques from the design to implementation that impacts the business.

  • Focus on Feature Engineering, Model Training and Model Evaluation in addition to data munging / wrangling

  • Identify the right algorithms and statistical techniques for a specific project as well as the best features for a model.  Advise junior members on the same.

  • Make business recommendations with effective presentations of findings at multiple levels of stakeholders

  • An active contributing member to the analytics community to help foster and grow the data science community at Sun Life

  • Champion and support diversity and inclusion

What will you need to succeed?

  • BSc/M.S. in a statistical, mathematical, or technical field (i.e., computer science) or equivalent experience

  • 3+ years experience in developing and implementing data science techniques (predictive, prescriptive, ML etc.)

  • Comfortable writing complex SQL queries to extract and integrate data from multiple database sources

  • Proficient in using one or more statistical programming languages (i.e., Python) for data science

  • Experience with AWS services including SageMaker is required for some roles

  • Experience with machine learning including supervised and unsupervised models

  • Demonstrated experience in data transformation & data manipulation

  • Experience working with Structured vs. Unstructured data

  • Experience with Big Data Technologies: Hadoop, HDFS, Hive, HBase, Spark is strongly desirable

  • Effective and concise oral and written storytelling and insights communication skills

  • Ability to work on multiple projects in parallel while managing constantly changing deadlines and priorities

  • Ability to document work and effectively prioritize documentation

 

What will be nice to have?

  • Past experience in life insurance/wealth management, or other financial services industry (e.g., retail banking, credit card, property and casualty insurance)

Unique Requirements

The candidate selected for this role is required to have special clearance from the Royal Canadian Mounted Police. To see if you are eligible for this clearance, please review the information on Federal Government site (https://www.tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca/esc-src/personnel/pdcf-rsrp-eng.html)

 ​

What\'s in it for you?

  • Remote/ Hybrid Work environment

  • Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data

  • 20 days vacation per year and an innovative sabbatical program

  • A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture

  • Being part of our Analytics community, where we share best practices and broaden skill-sets

  • Flexible Benefits from the day you join to meet the needs of you and your family

  • Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security

  • Fitness and wellness programs that help you balance work and life and enjoy a healthier lifestyle


 

The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results. 

Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Salary Range:

74,900/74 900 - 125,900/125 900

Job Category:

Advanced Analytics

Posting End Date:

13/03/2022

item.title: Senior Data Architect
item.description:
You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

Job Description:

Role Summary

This technical role is responsible for contributing to enterprise date architecture initiatives and programs that support business priorities and technical roadmap. This includes providing enterprise data architecture solutions and technical direction to Data teams in order to support and enhance ML/ AI and data analytics capabilities.

In this role you will design and create technical data models and schemas for advanced data architectures such as Data Fabric & Mesh on cloud. This is an innovation opportunity to gain experience with AI and ML initiatives on cloud for voice and text data. While we would prefer this experience, consider the AI aspect of this role a career development and learning opportunity!

The position can be located at the Sun Life office in Downtown Toronto, North York or Waterloo, depending on where a suitable candidate is found.

What Will You Do?

Reporting to the Director, Enterprise Data Architecture, you will work closely with the team of Enterprise Architects (across domains and platforms) and Data and Analytics Team who interact closely with the business in understanding business needs and architecting solution options. The role also interacts very closely with Data organizations across enterprise, where a team of individuals focus on the delivery of client centric business solutions.

The responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following:

  • Creates blueprints for data management systems to integrate, protect and maintain data patterns. Design concepts to make the flow of data in company as efficient as possible
  • Develop data models and schema designs to support platform / projects requirement. Supervise other architects use of tools and technologies.  
  • Scope the types of data management frameworks to be used.
  • Implement a data catalog of enterprise data assets and characteristics  
  • Develop a reference architecture that includes data domain specs
  • Specify data access methods and architects data services
  • Ensure compliance with data quality and protection policies
  • Work towards development both cloud and on premise, and Roadmap for i) Information Management ii) Advanced Analytics (Machine Intelligence) and Business Intelligence, and iii) Reporting domain at Sun Life. This includes the active management of understanding new and emerging technologies within the domains, and the active sunsetting of obsolete products.
  • Support Data and Analytics center in translating strategic requirements into usable enterprise data architectures.
  • Develop a metamodel management and repository strategy to manage all enterprise data architecture artifacts.
  • Identify data workload drivers for the selection between cloud and on premise, based on factors such as latency, consumption patterns and others for systems of record, engagement, and insight.
  • Develop, communicate, and support the implementation of corporate policies, standards, and procedures that provide effective architecture, governance, and management of Sun Life’s information/data assets.
  • Ensure projects are following best practice data architectures for delivery by the Data Engineering team.
  • Ensure the enterprise information architecture alignment to the overall enterprise architecture strategies.
  • Develop and maintain effective and efficient information management, business intelligence, and data analytics ownership awareness and training programs.

What will be needed to succeed?

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related area.
  • 6+ years experience in a large IT organization, within a minimum of 10 years in Information Management, Business Intelligence, and Data Analytics.
  • 5+ years experience architecting and implementing solutions involving information management, business intelligence, and data analytics in a large financial organization, or a large regulatory organization
  • Exposure to modern data architecture and knowledge of modern databases (RDBMS, No SQL, Graph, etc.)
  • Strong ability to balance a wide variety of trade-offs and drivers across the multiple skill areas contributing to, and impacting by, data architecture decisioning.
  • Knowledge in the architecture and design of information management architectures, business intelligence frameworks, and data analytics patterns that enable a well integrated, transactional, collaborative, and agile suite of systems.
  • Knowledge of cloud services - preferrably Amazon (AWS), including S3, Redshift, Sagemaker, Cloud formation and the various data and database formats available in cloud solutions such as Athena. Experience with other major cloud platforms can be considered.
  • Modeling experience within a large enterprise, within information management, business intelligence, and data analytics.
  • Understanding of common patterns, frameworks, and reference architectures for information management, business intelligence, and data analytics.
  • In depth knowledge of MDM through its initial setup, implementation, and execution, aligning to business use cases.
     

Competencies

  • Ability to manage through influence in a complex and evolving environment to meet challenging timelines and organizational goals.
  • Ability to establish and maintain a high level of customer trust and confidence.
  • Demonstrated problem solving, communication and organizational skills, a positive attitude, and the proven ability to negotiate and influence others to obtain desired results.
  • Strong professional consulting skills.
  • Ability to speak in business terms, as well as the ability to effectively communicate both internally and externally.
  • Mature, confident, and performance oriented.
  • An excellent communicator, team player and someone who is intellectually honest.
  • Ability to adapt thinking and response to the geographic differences across our global operations.

What’s in it for you?

  • Great Place to Work® Certified in Canada and the US - 2022
  • Great Place to Work® list for Best Workplaces for #HybridWork - 2022
  • Named “Best Places to Work” by Glassdoor - 2021
  • Canada Award for Excellence for Mental Health at Work - 2021
  • Flexible hybrid work model including in-country work-from-home if you prefer. #LI-Remote, or #LI-Hybrid.
  • Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security
  • Work and professional development that is united by our Purpose: to help Clients and Employees achieve lifetime financial security and live healthier lives
  • A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture
  • Be part of our continuous improvement journey in developing the next greatest digital enterprise experience.
  • Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data
  • A common sense dress code, where you decide how you dress based on your day
  • The opportunity to move along a variety of career paths with amazing networking potential

    The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results. 

    Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

    Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

    At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

    We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

    Salary Range:

    74,900/74 900 - 125,900/125 900

    Job Category:

    IT - Technology Services

    Posting End Date:

    09/03/2022

item.title: Director, Enterprise Data Architecture
item.description:
You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

Job Description:

We seek an experienced and high-performing individual to join our Enterprise Data architecture team as a Director, Enterprise Data Architecture. This leadership role is responsible for designing critical data systems in consultation with Sun Life’s Business and enterprise partners, including the holistic alignment of technologies, standards, and practices that enable Sun Life to deliver world class data and analytic systems. The Data Architecture team is an evolving group leading Sun Life in the application of leading-edge solutions for Sun Life business opportunities. This role will directly report into the Head (AVP) of Data Architecture.

In this role you will lead the design and implementation of advanced data architectures such as Data Fabric & Mesh on cloud. This is an innovation opportunity to gain experience with AI and ML initiatives on cloud for voice and text data. While we would prefer this experience, consider the AI aspect of this role a career development and learning opportunity!

 

What will you do?  

  • You’ll engage and lead the Data Strategy engagements with client executives, define data architectures for Enterprise engagements, and roll-up your sleeves and help the project team with complex technical issues 

  • Develop data patterns, define playbooks and technologies  

  • Collaborate with all regions on various delivery projects. 

  • Analyze structural requirements for new software and applications 

  • Lead technology POCs and pilots in the data and analytics domain in partnership with Data and analytics teams.  

  • Create and present tools/tech proposals and evaluations at EA Governance councils 

  • Provide leadership on the design & end-to-end solutions for building data & analytics applications on cloud and on-premise platforms 

  • Coordinate with Data life cycle management program in all aspects of the delivery 

  • Coordinate with the Data Science department to identify future needs and requirements 

  • Apply best practices to all solution architecture, design areas, including on-prem, AWS, or a combination. This includes areas such as Operational Excellence, Security, Reliability, Performance Efficiency, and Cost Optimization. 

  • Mentor other data systems designers (Data Architects), both within your team and within other ES or Business units, in order to support solution development and application of best practices. 

  • Translate detailed requirements into functional specifications. 

  • Provide high level estimates for project proposals and solution designs.  

  • Work with the solutions design team to drive data & analytics strategy across enterprise  

  • Provides consultation for the evaluation of complex data and software systems. 

  • Strong hands-on experience in delivering data analytics solution with proven business value  

  • You’ll mentor, develop, and proactively support practice capabilities including recruiting and development of leaders

​​

Major accountability   

  • Data, Business and Technical oriented.    

  • Partner with Data and Analytics delivery partners. 

  • Build and lead a team of data architects for delivery using Agile approach. 

  • Set up and provide governance on data architecture and technology standards.  

 

What do you need to succeed?  

  • Approximately 15+ years of build/design experience related to data service design, building data architecture and leading end to end implementations.

  • 3+ years with cloud based data architecture be it AWS, Azure, GCP or similar). AWS is preferred.

  • 5+ years in a financial services company (especially insurance) is preferred, but not necessarily required. 

  • Excellent documentation skills including technical writing, Visio, PowerPoint, flowcharting (5+ years)  

  • 5-7+ years’ experience in development, 3 of which in the capacity of Development and/or Design Lead. 

  • Strong knowledge on MDM, RDM, Data Modeling techniques, Data architecture patterns  

  • Background of working with Data governance and its application 

  • Experience in Machine Learning/AI methodologies and technologies such as Sagemaker, Azure Synapse Azure ML, R, Python, and Azure Data Bricks is preferred.

  • 5+ years’ experience acting in the capacity Senior Project roles for sizable IT projects. 

  • Strong experience in delivering projects in Big Data related projects using Cloud tech ( AWS or Azure or GCP or similar), data lake technologies like Glue, EMR, Redshift, Lambda and open source technologies like Python, Spark, Hive, Data Lake, Cassandra 

  • Delivery experience in data analytics and visualization solutions using any modern age tools like SAS, AWS Sagemaker, R Studio, Tableau 

  • Extremely strong communication, critical thinking, and analytical skills. This includes skills such as conceptual requirements interpretation, solution creation, and problem-solving abilities. 

  • Excellent collaboration and leadership skills, a proven ability to adapt to challenges, and a strong interest in coaching and mentoring colleagues. 

  • Experience with productionizing services at scale and related change management. 

  • Experience with project management and software development life cycle /SDLC; waterfall and agile (5+ years). Working experience on Kanban/Jira boards 

  • Proven experience in designing solutions for ODS, data warehouse system integrations 

  • Strong understanding of building DevOps pipelines for Data & analytics technologies. 3+ yrs. in DevOps (CI / CD) related technologies and must have implemented the same in 2-3 projects in the past 

What’s in it for you?

  • Great Place to Work® Certified in Canada and the US - 2022
  • Great Place to Work® list for Best Workplaces for #HybridWork - 2022
  • Named “Best Places to Work” by Glassdoor - 2021
  • Canada Award for Excellence for Mental Health at Work - 2021
  • Flexible hybrid work model including in-country work-from-home if you prefer. #LI-Hybrid.
  • Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security
  • Work and professional development that is united by our Purpose: to help Clients and Employees achieve lifetime financial security and live healthier lives
  • A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture
  • Be part of our continuous improvement journey in developing the next greatest digital enterprise experience.
  • Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data
  • A common sense dress code, where you decide how you dress based on your day
  • The opportunity to move along a variety of career paths with amazing networking potential

The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results. 

Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Salary Range:

104,000/104 000 - 171,700/171 700

Job Category:

IT - Application Development

Posting End Date:

09/03/2022

item.title: Senior Analytics & Automation Engineer
item.description:
You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

Job Description:

Role Summary

Analytics and Automation Center of Excellence is a focused Network Services group responsible in advancing Network Services’ capabilities in automation, orchestration, data analytics, tooling, and all aspects of functionality integrations within SLF ecosystem of tools and their capabilities in support of and in accordance to the guardrails set forth for Sunlife Digital Enterprise journey.

This role reports and operates under the general direction of the Director, Analytics and Automation Centre of Excellence. Successful Candidate will be working on several automation code development primarily for network services. This person will also play a major role in integrating a few digital platforms for tooling and analytics to increase operational efficiency in management of the enterprise network ecosystem, on-premises and in cloud.

                                                               

What will you do?

  • Advance enabling technologies for Automation, Data & Analytics, DevOps, API, and Platform Integration, within Network Services’ and business partners for on-premises or in-cloud services and technologies.

  • Develop and deploy automation and analytical solutions, data extraction tools, visualizations, dashboards, machine learning models, and promote analytics throughout DBTS.

  • Work and collaborate with other technical teams, architecture, business partners and stakeholders to support business strategies, improve processes, increase efficiencies, by delivering analytics and automation solutions that are effective and secure.

  • Cross-functionally work with other teams and partners in integration, automation, data consolidation, extraction, transformation, and load to effectively support Sun Life Financials’ Digital Enterprise.

  • Contribute and take responsibility for project related activities, including planning, project estimation, deployment, support and knowledge transfer in the form of workshops and trainings.

       

What do you need to succeed?

Education and Experience:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Information Technology (or equivalent experience)

  • Five (5) + years coding and development using one or more programming languages in Python, R, C++, Java, Perl

  • Five (5) + years of progressive network and information technology, data extraction, data visualization and analysis.

  • Two (2) + years Infrastructure as a Code hands-on experience using tools like, Terraform, CloudFormation, Ansible

  • Two (2) + Years progressive learning and hands-on in Network Programmability and integration with YANG, YAML, XML, JSON, NETCONF, RESTCONF

Network Specific Technological Skills:

Five years experience or strong understanding in the following areas

  • Operating Systems and IOS:

    • Cisco: IOS, NX-OS, ASA; Aruba: Wireless OS, Clearpass, Airwave/Central; Gigamon, Bluecat, Checkpoint, F5

    • Microsoft; Windows Servers 2012/2016/2019, UNIX/Linux/CentOS, and other derivatives.

    • Command Line Interface, Shell, SNMP

  • Applications and Tools Suite:

    • Microsoft: Visio, Office, Project

    • Linux/Unix and derivatives

    • Automation and Orchestration tools: Ansible, Cisco NSO, Cloud Formation, Terraform

    • Splunk, ScienceLogic, LiveAction/NX, Algosec, TGW Network Manager, ServiceNow, Agile tools: Jira, Git, Bitbucket, Scrum

Competencies:

  • Possesses leadership skills demonstrating integrity, professionalism, relationship building, to foster partnership and collaboration with regional peers, partners, and clients.

  • With advanced reasoning skills with the ability to define problems, evaluate trends in analytical data, establish facts, and draw supportable valid conclusions.

  • Experience in creating & managing business requirements, business processes and operational standards and procedures.

  • Thrives in an Agile and fast-paced environment, with the ability to stay calm in high risk, high pressure situations.

  • Development of comprehensive Engineering and Architecture documentations is mandatory.

Communication Skills:

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

  • Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work well with other teams, remaining professional, positive and patient at all times.

  • Ability to effective present and communicate solutions at all levels in our organization, leadership, stakeholders, partners and clients.

What is in it for you?

  • Best Workplace for Hybrid Work 2022

  • Canada Award for Excellence for Mental Health at Work – 2021

  • Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data

  • Flexible hybrid work model including work-from-home.

  • Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security

  • Work and professional development that is united by our Purpose: to help Clients and Employees achieve lifetime financial security and live healthier lives

  • A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture

  • Be part of our continuous improvement journey in developing the next greatest digital enterprise experience.

  • The opportunity to move along a variety of career paths with amazing networking potential

The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results. 

Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
